thread.title: Are Mets the National League favorites to reach the World Series? Las Vegas says ...
thread.title_full: Are Mets the National League favorites to reach the World Series? Las Vegas says ...

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Are Mets the National League favorites to reach the World Series? Las Vegas says ...
text:
Comments 
NEW YORK — The National League playoffs are almost upon us and we need to declare a favorite to ultimately tear down or fete. But it won't be the Mets . 
According to Bovada, the St. Louis Cardinals are the odds-on favorites to win the National League pennant. Bovada has them at 2/1 to win the N.L. and then 5/1 to win the World Series. Makes sense for a team that won 100 games and has the best record in baseball. 
The Mets are actually third in the pecking order but slightly. The Dodgers are at 3/1 to win the National League. The Mets are at 13/4. The Cubs and Pirates are at 5/1 each. 
The Mets will begin their playoff run Friday in Los Angeles when they face the Dodgers . Jacob deGrom will be on the mound, with Noah Syndergaard and Matt Harvey to follow. RELATED: 7 things that didn't happen that saved the 2015 Mets 
Here's the rest of the odds handed down by Bovada to win the World Series. #BlueJays (+300) are the favorites to win the #WorldSeries . #Yankees and #Astros are the biggest underdogs at +1400. pic.twitter.com/nbL0U9A8j1 — Bovada Official (@BovadaLV) October 5, 2015 
Why are the Cubs slightly more favored to win the World Series than the Pirates even though they have about the same record and have to play in the wildcard game? Who knows. 
And here are the American League pennant odds, if you're interested. 
Toronto Blue Jays: 3/2
